channel.title: ~~~items, models, nulls, big problem~~~
channel.description:
ok i was looking (client side) at ItemList (text document) and came across alot of cool items ex. ID: 15066 Name: Admin Platebody ID: 15067 Name: Admin Platelegs ID: 15068 Name: Admin Crown ID: 15069 Name: G-mod Crown ID: 15070 Name: Mod Crown ID: 15071 Name: SB-mod Crown ID: 15072 Name: Admin Boots ID: 15073 Name: Admin Kiteshield ID: 15074 Name: Admin Whip ID: 15075 Name: Mod Platebody ID: 15076 Name: Mod Platelegs ID: 15077 Name: Mod Boots ID: 15078 Name: Mod Kiteshield ID: 15079 Name: Mod Whip ID: 15080 Name: Admin Plateskirt ID: 15081 Name: Mod Plateskirt ID: 15082 Name: Owners Platebody ID: 15083 Name: Owners Platelegs ID: 15084 Name: Owners Boots ID: 15085 Name: Owners Kiteshield ID: 15086 Name: Owners Crown
......ok so i tried doing ::pickup 15082 1 and i got a null so i checked (server side) Items.cfg and searched for any of these and none showed up. i added some of these items (client side) to (server side) and kept the same ids thinking as long as the 2 ids match it will work. i still got null!!! :( sooooo how can i fix this because there are so many cool items in (client side) ItemList that i want to make work for my server so u can actually see them and not be nulls!

item.title: ~~~items, models, nulls, big problem~~~
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

add models to model folder, add the ints to class 8, then login on the client and most clients work if you say “add model 1234” ect, dont do :: before it because thats not how but thats a simple short guide, try looking at client help though if you need good help

Read full topic

item.title: ~~~items, models, nulls, big problem~~~
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

thanks so much. do u mind spending some time and teaching me step by step.

Read full topic

item.title: ~~~items, models, nulls, big problem~~~
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

you need the models and the int’s in your class 8 to your client, otherwise it will come up as a null when you spawn it

Read full topic

item.title: ~~~items, models, nulls, big problem~~~
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

ok i was looking (client side) at ItemList (text document) and came across alot of cool items
ex.
ID: 15066 Name: Admin Platebody
ID: 15067 Name: Admin Platelegs
ID: 15068 Name: Admin Crown
ID: 15069 Name: G-mod Crown
ID: 15070 Name: Mod Crown
ID: 15071 Name: SB-mod Crown
ID: 15072 Name: Admin Boots
ID: 15073 Name: Admin Kiteshield
ID: 15074 Name: Admin Whip
ID: 15075 Name: Mod Platebody
ID: 15076 Name: Mod Platelegs
ID: 15077 Name: Mod Boots
ID: 15078 Name: Mod Kiteshield
ID: 15079 Name: Mod Whip
ID: 15080 Name: Admin Plateskirt
ID: 15081 Name: Mod Plateskirt
ID: 15082 Name: Owners Platebody
ID: 15083 Name: Owners Platelegs
ID: 15084 Name: Owners Boots
ID: 15085 Name: Owners Kiteshield
ID: 15086 Name: Owners Crown

…ok so i tried doing ::pickup 15082 1 and i got a null so i checked (server side) Items.cfg and searched for any of these and none showed up. i added some of these items (client side) to (server side) and kept the same ids thinking as long as the 2 ids match it will work. i still got null!!! sooooo how can i fix this because there are so many cool items in (client side) ItemList that i want to make work for my server so u can actually see them and not be nulls!
